intro: Pedicularis yui, commonly known as the Japanese fairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Pedicularis yui is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
